unabashed_mediator_apprentice1: You know, that argument you had today with r_w was stupid.
You were both entitled. And you didn't end it, which doesn't make you better than {PRONOUN/r_w/object}.
Then I had to step in, which was unnecessary, because it was stupid.
You were spitting words at each other for nothing. It was uncalled for.
And I'm not afraid to tell you so.
assertivemediator_comfort: Just ... had a bad day, is all ...
*Sigh* y_c, have you ever felt like you're not enough for anyone?
Usually, when it comes to making a decision, I never hesitate. Whatever the obstacle, I'll run headfirst into it, no questions asked.

But, today, when negotiating with an enemy Clan, I said something risky and it completely backfired. Luckily, I was able to smooth things over, but because of me, the Clan could've been hurt, or worse.
I just feel like such a failure. A liability. Everyon in the Clan is depending on me, but what if I keep falling short?
[You offer t_c words of reassurance, but {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/seem/seems} troubled beyond comforting.]
[Still, you sit with {PRONOUN/t_c/object} through the night, hoping to stabilize {PRONOUN/t_c/object} through whatever storm {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} might be weathering right now.]
brooding_mediator: Oh, y_c. l_n has been wanting to see you about your performance.
Sorry. Couldn't tell you. You'll have to go see for yourself.
brooding_mediator_aboutneurotic: I swear to the Void, next time r_w_neurotic comes to me asking for assurance that some random slug doesn't hate {PRONOUN/r_w_neurotic/object}, I just might have to claw my own ears off.

I tell {PRONOUN/r_w_neurotic/object} over and over, 'all you have to do is ask', but {PRONOUN/r_w_neurotic/subject} never {VERB/r_w_neurotic/do/does}. Just {VERB/r_w_neurotic/apologize/apologizes} over and over for stuff {PRONOUN/r_w_neurotic/subject} {VERB/r_w_neurotic/don't/doesn't} know {PRONOUN/r_w_neurotic/subject} even did.
How can any cat outside of the nursery possibly be so debilitatingly insecure?
brooding_medapp: You ... want us to do a bonding exercise, to get to know each other better as mentor and apprentice?
[t_c stalks off before you can even finish explaining the exercise. Clearly, you'll need to find another way of getting through to {PRONOUN/t_c/object} ...]
brooding_medapp_2: [You notice your apprentice is looking a little stressed, and ask {PRONOUN/t_c/object} how {PRONOUN/t_c/subject}{VERB/t_c/'re/'s} feeling.]
Look, can we get one thing straight, y_c? I'm your apprentice, you're my mentor, that's it. That's all this has to be.
We don't need to get into any of the 'feelings' stuff, because it really isn't necessary. Got it?
[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/storm/storms} off, lashing {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} tail. If that isn't the most brutal little slug you've ever met in your life ...]
brooding_mediatorapp: What do you need, y_c? Who are you upset with?
[For such a young slugcat, t_c sure doesn't mince words ...]
brooding_mediatorapp_2: What is it, y_c? I was just about to leave with tm_n on a visit to c_nClan ...
[t_c casts a glance at {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} mentor over {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} shoulder, then turns back to you with a rare smile.]
It's okay. tm_n can wait. Now, tell me what's wrong.
brooding_mediatorapp_3: No. I refuse. You always come here, always have some banal argument for me to mediate.
Have you ever considered that maybe you're the problem?
You wouldn't have so much work for me if you didn't start so many discussions and provocations. Most of the time you're not even in the right.
You're obnoxious, annoying, stupid and self-absorbed. There, that's the answer. Now, kindly leave me to go find something worth my time.
[t_c just refused to help you out. But {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} can't do that ... Can {PRONOUN/t_c/subject}?]
brooding_mediatorapp_4: [For a mediator, t_c sure doesn't seem to talk much.]
assertive_jealous1: What did I do in a past life to wind up related to you, y_c?
assertive_medapp1: Hey, what does this herb do? Can I eat it?
Haha, don't look so stressed! I was just joking.
assertiveapp_medapp3: Hey, y_c ... is it really true that you can talk to the Ascended?
Whoa! That's so cool! What do the Ascended say that I'm gonna do? Am I gonna be strong? Am I destined for greatness?
... It doesn't work like that? Awh. That's no fun.
Well, if the Ascended ever mention me, you'll let me know, won't you?
assertive_apprentice7: y_c. Buddy. Best friend. We've GOTTA TRY this. r_c told me that if you eat three centipedes, one noodlefly, and howl at the moon, you get magic powers!
What? It's totally real, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} wouldn't lie to me like that! I prommissseee.
assertive_1: Ugh. Can you believe how cruel some cats are, y_c? A bunch of apprentices were trying to convince these two kits to sneak into a lizard den ... what a bunch of rot-brains.
No matter what, don't let anyone try to pressure you into doing something you don't think is right. Go with your gut, and stick to your own values. That's what's really important.
assertive_1_2: Hey there, y_c! Not bad weather today, hm?
Sun on my pelt, wind in my fur ... Could you imagine being a iterator's pet and having to be cooped up in a puppet room all day? I think I would go crazy!
Just another reason why it's great to be a Clan slugcat.
introspective_MdtorApp: [You hear t_c quietly groan to {PRONOUN/t_c/self} from the other side of the clearing.]
y_c, I can see you staring at me. If you want to say something, say it.
... No, I'm not angry at you. I'm sorry for snapping. My training's just going a bit rough.
I got into an argument with another slugcat from o_c_n about their current plans. They refused to listen to me when I had a better solution to their problem.
Makes me almost regret being a mediator. I hate talking to other slugs, they're just utterly full of problems they create for themselves, and they refuse to listen to obvious solutions.
But, I suppose I became a mediator apprentice to help other cats with their problems too. I suppose I've caught my mouse and I need to eat it.
Thank you for listening to me, y_c. I'll keep thinking of another solution they'll like.
introspective_MdtorApp_1: [You're sitting staring at a piece of fresh kill, when you feel something nudge into your shoulder, you turn your head to see t_c.]
You look a little... out of it. Are you feeling unwell? Do you want me to take you over to the medicine den?
... You heard someone you have a crush on flirting with someone else? Oh, y_c. I'm so, so sorry.
I think you're a wonderful slugcat, anyone would be truly lucky to be with you. If they can't see how great you are, that's their loss.
... I could talk to them, give them a poke into your direction, but I don't want to get too involved in your love life, you're plenty capable on your own.
I'd give yourself a break, and hold your head high, prove to them the slugcat you are.
brooding_medi_app: When you grow up, you won't cause any problems for me, right y_c?
introspective_MdtorApp_2: [t_c is sitting in the corner of camp, staring off into space.]
y_c...? How long have you been there for?
I'm just working through some advice my mentor gave to me earlier. It... makes sense in concept, I'm just having difficulty really wrapping my mind around it.
Huh? Oh, they told me that, in order for me to be able to help slugcats get along, I need to taste my own medicine and try to get along with people too.
I didn't think that I really... didn't get along with other slugs. I care about the other slugs in the Clan! It's my job!
... You think that's my problem? That I view others as people to help, rather than as friends? Is that what my mentor meant?
I never thought about that. I'll have to try getting to know other slugs, try and make some friends. Thank you for your thoughts, y_c.
introspective_MdtorApp_5: ... y_c? Is everything okay? I'm surprised you came out of your way to find me. Is there anything I can help with?

I'm not busy at all. I'm always here to lend an ear to any member of my Clan, from the leader to the littlest pup. We can go to the edge of the clearing if you wish to speak privately, pretend we're sharing tongues.

If it makes you feel any better, you're teaching me as I'm listening. You're allowing me to know what kind of problems everycat has, so I'm more able to help, and so I can suggest things to make everyone's day better.
'The more I hear, the more I know. The more I know, the further I go.' If I'm making a phrase about it.
That's advice I can give to you, no matter what. You'll only know if you try it, y_c.
Unless it's breaking the Warrior Code. Please don't do that.
introspective_MdtorApp_3: [t_c is pacing back and forth near the camp entrance.]
... Huh? Oh hi there. Sorry, I'll get out of the way.
... No, no. I'm okay. Just preparing to go to o_c_n. My mentor asked me to go discuss with their mediator about an agreement we've been having about borders.
I know they sent me, because they know I'm completely capable, and o_c_n is mostly willing to cooperate in this manner, but I'm still worried about it.
I just need to do it. I need to go do my job as a mediator, and go solve this problem. Take the rain deer by the antlers, so to speak.
Standing here wearing my paws into the floor is only giving me sore paw pads and a future trip to the medicine den. I'll see you later, y_c.
introspective_MdtorApp_4: [t_c is sat watching two of your Clanmates argue with each other, with fascination.]
[One of them calls the other a half-Clan rotheart. Quite brutal. Why is t_c not saying anything?]
[... A giant batfly flies out of a tree just behind the arguing cats.]
[t_c seems to come to awareness of what's going on around {PRONOUN/t_c/object}, and {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/rush/rushes} over to deal with the yelling slugcats.]
assertive_6: *Sigh*. Hey, y_c. Come to ruin the fun again?
Whatever. I'm going to go do something actually exciting. Don't wait up.
assertiveapp_leader: I'll make all of c_nClan proud!
assertive_elder: y_c, can you believe it? I actually got to mediate a real, serious argument today! Eeee, so cool!!!
I mean, uh, definitely not cool. I'm definitely very serious and respectful towards my sacred duty to my Clan.
assertive_elder_2: Er, sorry, y_c. I can't chat right now ...
tm_n really needs me to mediate this argument, and I kinda actually have to focus.
I'll come and find you as soon as I'm free, though, okay?
assertive_elder_3: Knowing what we know from mediating their conflicts, if everyslug in camp got into a fight ... Who d'you think would win?
Can be mental. Or physical. Either option would be interesting.
Personally, I'm betting on r_c ... in both categories.
assertiveapp_30: [t_c stumbles across camp to you, soaking wet and covered in mud.]
y_c! Before you get mad, I didn't do it!
[The very peeved-off looking deputy locks eyes with you and storms in your direction. What mischief did t_c get into this time?]
assertive_elder_4: Hey, slimebag. I brought you something!
[t_c lays a colorful feather at your paws.]
I know this is your favorite color, and you miss exploring the territory. So I knew I just had to bring it to you.
Yeah, yeah, don't get all soft on me, hehe. Wanna grab a meal together?
assertivewarrior_deputy2: Yeah, right. Like I have to take orders from you!
You may think you're a warrior, but all you do is sit on your haunches and boss everycat around all day. That's no warrior. That's a coward.
Go find some other cat to impose on.
assertivemediator_toqueen: Pups bickering again? *Sigh* I hear ya ...
Hard to reason with cats whose brains are basically still mush. But pupts are actually a lot more emotionally aware than you may realize.
All they want is to feel seen and understood, just like you or I or any other slugcat. When you don't take the time to listen to them, that's when they really lash out.
Try speaking to them like adults, respecting their feelings, and keeping in mind that they won't be able to communicate as well as we can.
assertivemediator_toqueen_2: y_c, I know the pups fight a lot, but maybe you don't have to come to me for everything?
Part of being a queen is understanding pup development, after all. You need to know how to navigate their emotions in order to help them grow into the best slugcats they can be!
How about, just this once, you try helping the pups resolve their quarrels on your own?
And if you mess up, I'll be right here to help you. It is my job, after all! *Wink*
assertivemediatorapp_2: I have my first meeting with another Clan today ... wish me luck, will ya?
When I get back, I'll tell you all about the other Clan's territory! Their leader, their prey ... Everything you've ever wondered about!
Don't wait up, huh? I'll be back before you know it!
assertivemedapp_3: [You ask t_c why {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} chose to become a mediator, given {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} adventurous personality.]
Ah, well, that's easy ... Mediation is full of adventure!
I get to explore far and wide, collaborating with mediators across territories, and get to know all sorts of different sklgus! That's plenty of excitement, no?

You might think you know life-or-death situations on the battlefield, but when you're a mediator, the stakes are even higher. My decisions could be the difference between peace among the Clans, or bloody mayhem.
There's lots of different paths a slugcat can take in this world, but I know this is the path for me. Can you say the same?
assertivemediatorapp_4: Hey! I brought ya back a little gift from o_c_n's territory.
[t_c brandishes a colorful, exotic flower and lays it at your paws.]
'Innit cool? I knew you'd like it!
I saw this other cool plant, too, but didn't get the chance to snag it ... Next time, I'll make sure to bring it back!
assertivemediatorapp_5: Ugh, it's sooo boring today. Everything's way too calm and peaceful. How am I supposed to do my job?
Hey, maybe we could get into a fight, and then I could mediate it? C'mon, take a jab at me! What's something I do that's always annoyed you?
But don't get too cocky. I'm armed and dangerous with conflict resolution skills! Haha!
assertivemediatorapp_6: Hey, y_c! When do we get to visit o_c_n territory? Can we go right now?

assertive_jealous1_2: Hey, so, remember when you cracked that joke today, and everybody laughed, and then I tried to be funny, and no one laughed?
... What was the deal with that?
assertivemediatorapp_9: Guess who just got told to go to the rotwound ... for the third time today.
Tell me you're having an easier time than me, y_c. Helping others all day can be the best thing in the world, but other times, it's just awful.
Still, the feeling I get when I successfully patch things up between two siblings, or help an elder reconnect with their pups ... it makes it all worth it!
assertive_warrior_or_elder: Arguments in the nursery, medicine den, and warriors' den, all at the same time ... Is there something in the air?

cool_1: Void knows why elders are always so grumpy...

cool_2: I was thinking, like... we're kind of the same right?

sweet_mediapp_1: Why hello there, little fella! Wow, I was that big once...?

sweet_mediapp_2: Hey there! I hope your day's going well? Ah- you seem upset, what's the matter?

Ah, I see now. Would you like to go and talk with {PRONOUN/r_c/object} about it? I wouldn't mind going with you. Ah right- it is my job now, hehe.

sweet_mediapp_3: Oh, what's it like training to be a mediator? Well, you see...
The training itself is admittedly a little boring, hehe... But when you're actually in the moment, it can be pretty tough figuring out what to do!
But seeing other slugcats smiling because I did something... it makes it all so worth it, you know?
Always choose what makes you happy, okay? I know you're just a kit now, but you matter just as much as I or anyone else does!
sweet_mediapp_4: Hey there y_c! Is there anything that you need?
Oh, you'd like to be better friends with r_c? Well, I'm a bit busy right now, but I can definitely help ya out! Anything for a little fella like you.
sweet_mediapp_5: Oh hey, y_c! I have a favor I'd like to ask of you. I need to go to o_c_n, can you come with me?
I'm gonna ask a few others too, so don't worry if you don't wanna go or you're busy! There was a situation at the border and I want to make sure no one's upset or anything.
sweet_mediapp_6: y_c...? Oh- I'm fine, don't worry about me! I was just doing a lot of thinking.
I want to help everyone I can, but I... I don't know. I feel like I could be so much more useful out there, not just in c_nClan. Am I weird for that?
I adore c_nClan, but... I saw some o_c_n apprentices fighting, but when I tried to help they told me to keep my nose in my own Clan's business.
... Thank you for listening to me. It really means a lot, you know? Ah- I'm sure you came to ask me for something, what is it you need?
sweet_mediapp_7: Ah, y_c! What seems to be the problem?
You feel like your mentor is pushing you too hard with battle training? I see.. Come on, we can go talk to m_n together! I'm sure we can come to a compromise.
sweet_mediapp_8: Mm, hey y_c? Can... Can I ask you something?
I've just been thinking a lot... we've got a lot of responsibility, you being a queen's apprentice and me being a mediator apprentice...
If we make one mistake, it could jeopardize the Clan.. I'm not normally the type to get too stressed out about this stuff, I'm normally the one that's comforting stressed out slugcats...
But... if you wouldn't mind, y_c... Can I lean on your shoulder for just a moment? ... and just... forget those responsibilities... for just a second.
sweet_mediapp_9: [t_c lets out a loud sigh, laying down right in the entrance of the medicine den. {PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/seem/seems} exhausted.]
H- Hey, y_c? If you wouldn't mind... I think I need something for a headache...

sweet_mediapp_11: Hey y_c! What seems to be the issue?

sweet_mediapp_12: [t_c seems to be shaking pretty bad, staying in the corner of the camp. As you approach {PRONOUN/t_c/object}, {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/seem/seems} to jolt, wiping away {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} tears.]
I'm sorry you have to see me like this, I'm supposed to be the one who knows what to do...
[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/hiccup/hiccups} as {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/say/says} that, shaking more. Who made this sweet cat so upset?]

[As {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/bury/buries} {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} face in your chest, you give {PRONOUN/t_c/object} the best reassuring words you can. t_c does {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} best, and is always happy to help everycat, you can't understand who would say otherwise.

sweet_mediapp_13: Hey y_c! How's talking with r_w been?
Oh I see... I'll go talk to {PRONOUN/r_w/object} about that! Thank you for letting me know!
sweet_mediapp_14: [{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} awkwardly {VERB/t_c/turn/turns} {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} paw over, to show a couple small scratches on {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} paw.]
The pups were fighting, so I went to mediate... Uh- turns out they were fake-fighting just to help me get their moss ball off the roof of the nursery.
r_k was just too cute to say no to... and now I've got scratches on my paw. At least they have their ball back.
[You're starting to feel like t_c is a little too helpful.]
sweet_mediapp_15: Hey y_c...? Uh- Hypothetically- If you ran into two rogues on the territory fighting over a couple's issue, what would you say to them?

...And your answer definitely doesn't involve trying to politely offer them help with finding a home?
...And them assuming you meant you'll let them move into YOUR home, and them getting mad and ignoring you when you say that's not what you said?
[As you hear shouting near the entrance... you decide to step in for t_c on this one.]
sweet_mediapp_16: [t_c wanders into the Nursery, a very tired pup in {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} jaws. {PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/place/places} the kitten at your paws, a concerned look on {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} otherwise kind expression.]

I feel like we need to talk to the other pups about this... This isn't okay. Oh- if you'd be alright if I tagged along, of course! I just... I feel really bad about this...
sweet_mediapp_17: What seems to be the issue, y_c? I hope everything's alright.
Oh! Some slugcats were refusing to go on patrol, despite not having done anything in a few days?
Thanks for letting me know! I'll go check up on them!
sweet_mediapp_18: You're concerned...? I think I understand... I get really stressed when it comes to mediating.
I just care so much about the Clan, even about cats outside this Clan. I want to help them so badly!

sweet_mediapp_20: Oh y_c!! Is something the matter? I'm happy to help with anything you need!

sweet_mediapp_23: [You and r_e were fighting over which best place to sun was. It was a petty fight, sure, but you felt too invested to go back.]

sweet_mediapp_24: Hey, y_c? I think I need your help for something, if you wouldn't mind?
r_k was frightened pretty badly, and has been lashing out at everyslug.
{PRONOUN/r_k/subject/CAP}{VERB/r_k/'ve/'s} always really loved your stories... so I think it'd mean a lot if you went in there and told {PRONOUN/r_k/object} one.
Thank you so much! Expect a fresh nest tomorrow, as a thank you gift!
sweet_mediapp_25: [t_c bounds in with a purr, fresh prey in {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} maw soon being lowered to your paws.]

neurotic_app4: Gah, stupid, stupid, so stupid, t_c ...
Wuh - y_c? How long have you been standing there?
Why was I talking to myself ...?
*Sigh* It's, like, the dumbest thing ever. t_mn gave me this surprise assessment today, and I totally flunked it!
How could I have answered that the fastest way to o_c_n is by swimming up to the border? It doesn't even make any sense!
I just know that t_mn is still laughing at me ... The whole Clan probably is.

But, if I'm not hard on myself, then how will I ever become stronger?
I refuse to be an embarrassment to my Clan and mentor. I'll pass that assessment next time ... Whatever it takes!
assertive_mediatorapp_AJ: y_c, can you believe it? I actually got to mediate a real, serious argument today! Eeee, so cool!!!
I mean, uh, definitely not cool. I'm definitely very serious and respectful towards my sacred duty to my Clan.
assertive_mediatorapp_AJ1: Er, sorry, y_c. I can't chat right now ...
tm_n really needs me to mediate this argument right now, and I kinda actually have to focus.
I'll come and find you as soon as I'm free, though, okay?
assertive_mediatorapp_AJ2: Knowing what we know from mediating their conflicts, if everysluf in camp got into a fight ... Who d'you think would win?
Can be mental. Or physical. Either option would be interesting.
Personally, I'm betting on r_c ... in both categories.
assertivemediatorapp_AJ3: [t_c stumbles across camp to you, soaking wet and covered in mud.]
y_c! Before you get mad, I didn't do it!
[The very peeved-off looking deputy locks eyes with you and storms in your direction. What mischief did t_c get into this time?]
assertivemediator_toqueen_AJ: Kits bickering again? *Sigh* I hear ya ...
Hard to reason with slugs whose brains are basically still mush. But pups are actually a lot more emotionally aware than you may realize.
All they want is to feel seen and understood, just like you or I or any other slugcat. When you don't take the time to listen to them, that's when they really lash out.
Try speaking to them like adults, respecting their feelings, and keeping in mind that they won't be able to communicate as well as we can.
assertivemediator_toqueen_AJ1: y_c, I know the pups fight a lot, but maybe you don't have to come to me for everything?
Part of being a queen is understanding pup development, after all. You need to know how to navigate their emotions in order to help them grow into the best cats they can be!
How about, just this once, you try helping the pups resolve their quarrels on your own?
And if you mess up, I'll be right here to help you. It is my job, after all! *Wink*
assertivemediatorapp_AJ4: I have my first meeting with another Clan today ... wish me luck, will ya?
When I get back, I'll tell you all about the other Clan's territory! Their leader, their prey ... Everything you've ever wondered about!
Don't wait up, huh? I'll be back before you know it!
assertivemediatorapp_AJ5: [You ask t_c why {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} chose to become a mediator, given {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} adventurous personality.]
Ah, well, that's easy ... Mediation is full of adventure!
I get to explore far and wide, collaborating with mediators across territories, and get to know all sorts of different slugcats! That's plenty of excitement, no?

You might think you know life-or-death situations on the battlefield, but when you're a mediator, the stakes are even higher. My decisions could be the difference between peace among the Clans, or bloody mayhem. It's terrifying ... But thrilling, too!
There's lots of different paths a scug can take in this world, but I know this is the path for me. Can you say the same?
assertivemediatorapp_AJ6: Hey! I brought ya back a little gift from o_c_n's territory.
[t_c brandishes a colorful, exotic flower and lays it at your paws.]
'Innit cool? I knew you'd like it!
I saw this other cool plant, too, but didn't get the chance to snag it ... Next time, I'll make sure to bring it back!
mediator_like_AJ: Ugh, it's sooo boring today. Everything's way too calm and peaceful -- how am I supposed to do my job?
Hey, why don't you go pick a fight with r_c, and then I can swoop in and mediate it?
Or, maybe we could get into a fight? C'mon, take a jab at me!
But don't get too cocky! I'm armed and dangerous with conflict resolution skills! Haha!
assertivemediatorapp_AJ7: Hey, y_c! When do we get to visit o_c_n territory? Can we go right now?
Are we allowed to just cross the borders as we please or is there some sort of warning system involved?
Does the o_c_n mediator know about me yet?
Ah, whatever. I'm sure I'll find out when I get there. Let's go!!!
[t_c takes off across camp. You aren't quite sure how to tell {PRONOUN/t_c/object} there wasn't even a o_c_n visit scheduled for today.]
assertivemediatorapp_AJ8: y_c? I might've ... goofed something up.
d_n and r_w were fighting, and I tried using the de-escalation strategies you taught me, but they wouldn't listen! They just kept on arguing louder and louder!
Yeah, maybe a little. But it's not my fault! They wouldn't stop arguing!
[You explain to your apprentice the importance of making all parties feel heard and understood while mediating a conflict.]
Thanks, y_c. Next time, I won't let you down!
assertivemediatorapp_AJ9: *Sigh* Looks like r_c and r_w are fighting again ...
Do you wanna handle this one, or should I?
assertivemediatorapp_AJ10: Guess who just got told to go to the Rotwound... for the third time today.
Tell me you're having an easier time than me, y_c. Helping others all day can be the best thing in the world, but other times, it's just awful.
Still, the feeling I get when I successfully patch things up between two siblings, or help an elder reconnect with their kits ... it makes it all worth it.
assertivemediatorapp_AJ11: Look, y_c, if you have a problem with somebody, you can't be shy about it!
Honesty is key! It doesn't help anyone to keep everything all bottled up inside. You have a voice, so you gotta use it!
Sure, my job is keeping the peace, but sometimes the best way to resolve a conflict is to start it. Y'know?
assertive_warrior_or_elder2: Arguments in the nursery, medicine den, and warriors' den, all at the same time ... Is there something in the air?
Without you here, y_c, I genuinely don't know what I would've done. Died, probably. Like, actually died.
silly_mediatorapp_hysterical: [You enter camp after an utterly uneventful hunting patrol and see t_c's charming attempt at a greeting through what seems like hysterical laughter.]
y_c! HAH! You just missed- *giggle* You just missed the FUNNIEST thing I've ever seen!
There was- there was a frog on the camp edge, and- hahaHAHAHA- and then it- and then it... oh Silverpelt, the frog- it...
It did a backflip and landed on my head!
[Indeed, there is an adorable looking frog on t_c's tail. t_c seems to have made an easy companion out of the passive creature.]
silly_mediatorapp_costume: [The mediator apprentice has been walking around all day in some sort of disguise, decorating {PRONOUN/t_c/self} in leaves and twigs that seem to have at least some rhyme or reason. Intrigued, you come up to {PRONOUN/t_c/object} to ask why {PRONOUN/t_c/subject}{VERB/t_c/'ve/'s} decorated {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} pelt today.]
Oh! Well, y_c, r_c was feeling down, so I wanted to cheer {PRONOUN/r_c/object} up by dressing myself up!
...Nevermind, I can't say that! I refuse to admit that I'm nosy! Bye, y_c!
[t_c shimmies away in {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} leafy fire hazard.]
silly_mediatorapp_plan: y_c! You see r_c arguing with d_n over there about c_nClan's fresh-kill stock? Well, I wasn't sure how to help resolve the situation, but now I think I have the perfect plan!
...Hey, don't "oh no" me! I'm not asking for your opinion, I just need you to watch me in case it all goes wrong!

[t_c struts over to the two bristling cats, not-so-quietly singing "This is the greatest plaaan!" to themself as they approach. Unsurprisingly, the apprentice's bubbly approach returns nothing... shouldn't someone know to stop them by now?]
silly_mediatorapp_ideas: Oh dear... y_c, I dunno what to do!
d_n is having this issue with r_c and I don't wanna tell you exactly what it is but I'm stuck between offering them two different solutions...
One of them is a little less conventional but I think it would work better. But they'd probably accept the more conventional one more easily.
[After thinking for a moment, you offer t_c your best advice.]
Oh... Thank you, y_c! I'll try that, then.
mediator_to_newborn_H1: Well, hello, y_c! Welcome to the world.
[As t_c shifts closer, you hiss and spit at {PRONOUN/t_c/object}. The mediator startles back.]
I'm going to have my paws full with you, huh?
neurotic_skillhealer_SQ2: Um... sorry, y_c? I don't mean to bother you, but plove_r_c has a bit of a sore throat. Could I have some honey from your stores to give them?
O-of course, you could give it to them, too! I don't mean to overstep.

[There's not much that can go terribly wrong with honey. Since t_c seems to know {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} way around medicine despite not being a cleric, you give {PRONOUN/t_c/object} a dollop of honey on a stick and send {PRONOUN/t_c/object} on {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} way.]
neurotic_fromyourkit_SQ2: [As t_c follows tm_n_neutral out of camp, {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/look/looks} back at you with a nervous smile.]
[You wave in farewell, wishing {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} could feel your pride. t_c waves back.]
assertive_elder2: *Sigh* Can't you see I have important things to do, y_c?
Go back to catching batflies, or whatever it is you warriors do.
brooding_mediator_AJ: [You finish a rant to t_c, the mediator, about how you annoyed you are at something that r_c did earlier.]
... Okay. Have you tried talking to {PRONOUN/r_c/object} about it?
[... You concede that you have yet to.]
*Sigh*. Useless. Everyone in this Clan is so terrified of confrontation all of a sudden.
r_c is never going to change if {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/don't/doesn't} know how you feel, y_c. You need to be direct. No cat has ever been killed by some brutal honesty.
If you spend your whole life worrying about trodding on the toes of others, you'll never get anything done.
Now, do you want me to help you work out what you'll say?
neurotic_mediatorapp_SQ1: [tm_n is going to discuss diplomatic matters with o_c_n, and is bringing t_c along to observe the proceedings.]

[t_c fidgets by the camp entrance, clearly nervous about representing the entirety of c_nClan. When {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/notice/notices} you looking, {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} awkwardly {VERB/t_c/duck/ducks} behind a rock.]
neurotic_skillstory_SQ8: A queen in o_c_n was telling their pups a story when I visited their camp with l_n last moon. I can't stop thinking about it.
It was so different from any story I'd heard before, with completely new cats. I really wanted to hear the end, but the queen took the kits inside when they realized we were there.
*sigh* It's silly, but it bothers me that I'll never know how it ends. And even if I see that queen again, I'd never be brave enough to ask.
mediator_gen_youshunned_rad2: y_c, if you needed conflict resolution skills, you could've just asked.
mediatorapp_youshunned_gen_rad1: Correct me if I'm wrong, but...
Aren't you supposed to be teaching me how to prevent stuff like this?
